00061 static struct sockaddr_in       vsls_local;

00117 int vslcl_Open(void)
00118 {
00119         int iReturn = 0;
00120         
00121         //get socket descriptor
00122         iVSLSocket=socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
00123         if (iVSLSocket < 0)
00124         {
00125                 iVSLCLStatus = VSLCL_STATUS_OFF;
00126                 return -EVSLCL_SOCKET;
00127         }
00128 
00129         // initialize client structure - that's me
00130         vsls_local.sin_family = AF_INET;                        // Ethernet
00131         vsls_local.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY); // automatically insert own address
00132         vsls_local.sin_port = htons(0);                 // set vslab server port
00133         memset(&(vsls_local.sin_zero), 0x00, 8);                // set remaining bytes to 0x0
00134 
00135         // initialize server structure - there's nothing to be done by OS, we have to set it
00136         // "at our own risk"...
00137         vsls_remote.sin_family = AF_INET;                       // Ethernet
00138         vsls_remote.sin_addr.s_addr = inet_addr(unicast_addr);
00139         vsls_remote.sin_port = htons(VSLS_PORT);
00140         memset(&(vsls_remote.sin_zero), 0x00, 8);
00141 
00142         // bind socket
00143         iReturn = bind(iVSLSocket, (struct sockaddr *)&vsls_local, sizeof(struct sockaddr));
00144         if (iReturn < 0)
00145         {
00146                 close(iVSLSocket);
00147                 iVSLCLStatus = VSLCL_STATUS_OFF;
00148                 return -EVSLCL_BIND;
00149         }
00150 
00151         // set library status
00152         iVSLCLStatus = VSLCL_STATUS_ON;
00153 
00154         return EVSLCL_NOERROR;
00155 }

00167 int vslcl_Close(void)
00168 {
00169         // check library status
00170         if (iVSLCLStatus != VSLCL_STATUS_ON) return -EVSLCL_STATUS_OFF;
00171 
00172         // close socket
00173         close (iVSLSocket);
00174 
00175         // set library status
00176         iVSLCLStatus = VSLCL_STATUS_OFF;
00177 
00178         return EVSLCL_NOERROR;
00179 }

00192 int vslcl_call_function(int fid, int *param)
00193 {
00194         unsigned int i = 0, iSndLen = 0, iRcvLen = 0;
00195 
00196         // create request packet...
00197         pl_create_request(&vsls_data);
00198 
00199         // set function id
00200         PLM_FUNCTION_ID(vsls_data) = fid;
00201 
00202         // set operands
00203         for (i=0; i < PL_OPERAND_COUNT; i++) PLM_OPERAND(vsls_data, i) = param[i];
00204 
00205         // serialize packet
00206         pl_make_packet(&vsls_data, sndpacket, PL_PACKETSIZE);
00207 
00208         // send packet
00209         iSndLen = sendto(iVSLSocket, &sndpacket, PL_PACKETSIZE, 0, (struct sockaddr*)&vsls_remote, sizeof(struct sockaddr));
00210 
00211         // receive packet and check for timeout error
00212         i = sizeof(struct sockaddr);
00213         tol_start_timeout(5);
00214         iRcvLen = recvfrom(iVSLSocket, &rcvpacket, PL_PACKETSIZE, 0, (struct sockaddr*)&vsls_remote, &i);
00215         tol_stop_timeout();
00216         if (tol_is_timed_out()) {
00217                 return -EVSLCL_NET_TIMEOUT;
00218         }
00219 
00220         // extract packet received
00221         pl_extr_packet(rcvpacket, &vsls_data, iRcvLen);
00222 
00223         // copy returned values...
00224         for (i=0; i < PL_OPERAND_COUNT; i++) param[i] = PLM_OPERAND(vsls_data, i);
00225 
00226         // create return value according to the returned packet...      
00227         if (PLM_PACKET_TYPE(vsls_data) == PL_PTYPE_ERR) return -PLM_OPERAND(vsls_data, 0);
00228         if (PLM_PACKET_TYPE(vsls_data) == PL_PTYPE_RSP) return EVSLCL_NOERROR;
00229         return -EVSLCL_UNKNOWN_ERROR;
00230 }

00243 int vslcl_Multiply(int op1, int op2, int *result)
00244 {
00245         int iReturn = 0, params[PL_OPERAND_COUNT];
00246         unsigned int i = 0;
00247 
00248         // check library status
00249         if (iVSLCLStatus != VSLCL_STATUS_ON) return -EVSLCL_STATUS_OFF;
00250 
00251         // set operands
00252         params[0] = op1;
00253         params[1] = op2;
00254         for (i = 2; i < PL_OPERAND_COUNT; i++) params[i] = 0;
00255 
00256         // call vslab server function
00257         iReturn = vslcl_call_function(PL_FID_MUL, params);
00258 
00259         // set return values
00260         if (iReturn<0) return iReturn;
00261         *result = params[0];
00262         return iReturn;
00263 
00264 }

00277 int vslcl_Divide(int op1, int op2, int *result)
00278 {
00279         int iReturn = 0, params[PL_OPERAND_COUNT];
00280 
00281         // check library status
00282         if (iVSLCLStatus != VSLCL_STATUS_ON) return -EVSLCL_STATUS_OFF;
00283 
00284         // set operands
00285         params[0] = op1;
00286         params[1] = op2;
00287         for (iReturn = 2; iReturn < PL_OPERAND_COUNT; iReturn++) params[iReturn] = 0;
00288 
00289         // call vslab server function
00290         iReturn = vslcl_call_function(PL_FID_DIV, params);
00291 
00292         // set return values
00293         if (iReturn<0) return iReturn;
00294         *result = params[0];
00295         return iReturn;
00296 
00297 }

00311 int vslcl_SetUnicastAddress(char *address) {
00312 
00313         if (address == NULL) return -EVSLCL_NULLPTR;
00314         if (strlen(address) > IP_ADDR_LEN) return -EVSLCL_WRONGADDRLEN;
00315         strncpy(unicast_addr, address, IP_ADDR_LEN);
00316         return EVSLCL_NOERROR;
00317 }
